intro: Bergia aestivosa, commonly known as the summer bergia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange, typically blooming during the warmer months. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand coastal conditions such as salt spray and strong winds. Bergia aestivosa is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal.
